description:
From the rules:  Roll the dice and place them on the Quidditch Pitch to earn goals and catch the Golden Snitch, or to block your opponent from scoring.  The first player to "catch" the Golden Snitch ends the match, and the player with the most Goal Points wins!

Components:
1 trunk (travel-size game case)
1 score board & die holder
1 Quaffle Die (Red 12-Sided)(*)
2 Bludger Dice (Black 12-Sided)(*)
1 Golden Snitch Die (Gold 6-Sided)
1 Keeper Die (Black 6-Sided)
4 Goal Dice (Blue 6-Sided)
2 Quaffle Score Markers (1 Blue, 1 Red)
2 Golden Snitch Score Markers (1 Blue, 1 Red)

(*) All 3 12-sided dice in this game are actually 12-sided D6's (meaning they are numbered from 1-6 twice).

Players are attempting to gain "tricks" of three bird cards: a male, female and young of the same species. The game uses a deck of cards, comprising: 75 bird cards (3 of each species), 6 Hazards, 6 Protection cards and 1 Appeal card.

6 cards are dealt to each player at the start of the game. The players then pick a card from the deck (or discard pile) and then play. Sets of species are built (Male, then Female, then Young) and a completed set forms a trick and is put to one side. Sets are built up in the spaces along the edge of the board facing the player; the species has to go in the appropriate habitat (as indicated on the card).

Partial sets can be protected by Protection cards and destroyed by Hazard cards. The Appeal card allows you to take one card from another player, in return for the Appeal card, which can then be used again by its new owner. Some of the species are "Rare Species". Completing these sets gains the player the appropriate counter.

To end the game you have to get a certain number of sets of species, with the rare ones counting for 2 or 3, depending on the value on the counter. Points are then totaled, with each species set being worth 50 points, with the appropriate multiplier (x2 or x3) for the "Rare" species, and cards in front of each player (but not yet in completed sets) being worth 10 points each.

Another game to play SuDoKu - a kind of crossword puzzle from Japan.

In the beginning you have to copy one of many tasks from a small card to the washable boardgame by using a marker.

Now you can start the game.
Every player has 30 seconds to find numbers that match in the cells. The other players have, first to control the time and second, the correctness of the numbers.
To write the numbers on the board, every player uses his own marker in a different color.

After finishing the puzzle, every player has to sum up the numbers he had put in - the player with the highest sum wins.

Unusual game from Transogram that really relies on components which glow in the dark for gameplay mechanics.  Comes in a very large box (17" x 12" x 8").

The game consists of a large hat with spring platform, four plastic rabbits (three of which glow in the dark), a large silk Hocus Pocus handkerchief, a wand with four detachable tips and many rings that are the game's 'currency' which also glow in the dark and must be  worn on the fingers of players.

When a player has won enough rings during gameplay (they must be wearing 10 rings BEFORE their turn) they get the opportunity to insert the tip of the wand into the hat & release the spring, causing the rabbits to pop up in the air.  This may or may not occur, depending on whether the correct wand tip is chosen.

The first player to make the rabbits fly out of the hat is the winner.

Although this game can be played in the light (by pretending the black rabbit is 'invisible') it is much more atmospheric and exciting in the dark.

An LPS bonus mini-game, Assault On Narvik is a simulation of the ground, sea and air battles that raged around the far northern port of Narvik in Norway during the spring of 1940.  Gamers can take both games and compare just how much each side learned about amphibious operations in the three years that separated the two battles.

The game has an 11" by 17" map, 95 half-inch counters, 2 pages of charts and tables and 10 pages of rules. The game covers the Allied landings just after the Royal Navy went in and blew out of the water the German destroyer flotilla (that had just landed their troops).

The game uses a clever mechanic that ties in units' Fatigue Levels whenever they perform any sort of operation (move, attack, defend, retreat, you get the picture). The terrain and weather were so inhospitable that units can get worn down pretty quick, and players have to be thinking ahead to win the game.

Rules cover formation integrity, air support (mostly the Luftwaffe), limited intelligence, combined arms, even an armistice and/or internment of German units in Sweden. There is a lot packed into this little game, and we're very happy to be able to "shoe-horn it in."

"Two decks and a book of games for all the family."

This set includes two decks of regular playing cards, and a 144 page book with rules for card games.  The table of contents is organized as follows:
1. History of Playing Cards
2. Rules of Play
3. Children's Games (12)
4. Social Games (22)
5. Games of Skill (12)
6. Gambling Games (14)
7. Solitaire Games (10)
8. Further Reading & Index

Try to catch as many fish as you can with the help of Paula. 
On a Magnificent wooden board the whale is placed right in the middle. You have to use Paula on the edge of the board (wooden Pawn) and a string (connected to the whale) to catch the fish. This is much more difficult as you think, because you have to act under pressure of time.

There is an expert rule: Throw a  die and catch only the fish of this certain color.

The author Robert F. Watson is better known on the BGG as robbirob.

Players select their contestant from a pool of four supplied small dolls, complete with swimsuit.  A robe is purchased for each and play commences with Miss World contestants circling the board on their 'World Tour', earning money for various tasks.  When a contestant thinks they have accrued enough money (points) they may elect to parade on the Miss World catwalk stage.  Each space on the stage costs points (money) and any contestant who runs out of points is eliminated.

The first player to reach the Golden Spotlight on the stage is awarded the winner's crown and the title of Miss World 'to the enthusiastic applause of all beaten contestants' - so sayeth the rules!

Perhaps the only Euro-game to have a huge following in Japan, its popularity has spawned the Rockman Edition of Settlers of Catan. Rockman - known in North America as Megaman - is a well known video game character around the world, and the number of games in the Rockman line continues to be churned out until today.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

From the publisher:

Xtreme Zombie Hunter is a comedic table-top miniatures game compatible with all 25mm miniatures of Zombies and the personality types that might hunt them. Set in a fictitious modern day America where Zombies are real and hunting them on national TV has become all the rage! XZH delivers a simple system, which is character driven to encourage replayability, full of laughs and can be enjoyed by 1 or more players. XZH lets you experience the hysterical nature of a B style Zombie movie with a twist.

DEAD LINK
Home Page: http://www.xtremezombiehunter.com/

Players group together up to 4 teams.  Each team have to answer questions regarding trivia from different years (80 to 89) sometimes by drawing or acting out the answers, winning a token for each year they answer correctly.  Categories include TV, Music, Movie, Sports and a category on fads (products, toys, news and events).  The first team to collect 10 tokens, one for each year, wins the game.

This is a game where you attempt to get the most money at the end of the game.  You purchase stocks throughout the game, and when all of the stock for a company has been purchased, the stock gets sold.  You get a bonus if you are the first to sell the stock in a company.

Nature of the Beast: City vs Suburb is a witty, gritty expandable card game that focuses on recruiting animals and strategic control of your playing field.  The first player to gain control of their entire field wins.
  
Players recruit animals, promote leaders, purchase equipment, find locations, enlist legendary animals, and befriend human allies.  Players also keep track of two tallies during the game: Favor and Fury.  Favor indicates how much 'pull' you have with humanity.  Fury indicates how much of a threat humanity sees you as.  Fury is gained by attacking your opponents.  Gaining Fury can allow you to take advantage of sinister 'Dark Nature' cards, but gaining too much can eliminate you from the game.

This Battle Box features two 70-card faction decks: City and Suburb.
City animals are tough and maintain close ties with humanity.  Suburb animals are not the largest but they are cunning.

Integrates with:

    Nature of the Beast: Farm vs. Forest
    Nature of the Beast: Prairie vs. Polar

"The 400" Game - "The Aristocrat of Games"
Manufactured by Morris Systems Publishing Company
Copyright 1933

"Know 400 pertinent facts about a subject and you will have laid the foundation to become master of it".

Game comes with:
8 32-page question and answer books,
6 score pads with instructions,
1 spinner.

The question and answer books are in the following topics:

Riddles
Etiquette
World Events
Love and Marriage
American History
Famous Sayings
Foods and Cooking
Spelling (National Spelling Bee Series)

Bears the 1933 National Recovery Act (NRA) Eagle Emblem "We do our part"
on the box front and spinner box.
Take as much part of the board, by placing straws in different sizes. The straws are randomized by a dice. Straws can also be taken away if they are not part of an enclosed area.

The gameshop 'de Joker' in Utrecht, Netherlands, released 18kaas, an 1830 style 18xx-game in Holland (different from Rob & Paul's 1839 and different from Theo Jansma's version), available in fold-able or hardboard and mounted map style, party proof version (1830: Railways & Robber Barons components required). In 2004 another 100 copies were available.

Though this uses components of 1830 this is not an expansion, but is a separate standalone game.

(from bsa-gyc.org):

The world's best-loved board game now celebrates 95 years of strong Scouting values, leadership, and fun! Monopoly®: Boy Scouts of America is played just like the original game, but now features a custom board, cards, money, and pewter playing tokens, including a campaign hat, pocketknife, Scoutmaster cup, Boy Scout sign, flashlight, and Yucca backpack. This officially licensed Monopoly game is great fun for the pack, troop, team, family, and friends. A perfect gift for anyone in Scouting.

Candle Quest is a quick set-collection, auction and money-management game in which you buy/sell/auction cards in order to be the first to collect the entire set of candles necessary to light your Menorah.

On your turn, you either flip over a card from the draw pile, then buy, sell, or auction the card; or loot a card from a personal discard pile. The auction starts with you and goes once around but does not come back to you. If you win the auction, you pay the bank; if another player wins, they pay you and take the candle. In addition to candles, the deck includes unlit candles that you must pay off, but which can be used to pay off other unlit candles or loot candles. The deck also includes dancing candles that are wild, and can be used in place of any color.

In the basic game, the first player to collect all eight differently colored candles wins. In the advanced game, the player with the highest score at game's end wins. Candle Quest includes a junior  variant for ages five and six that removes auctions and discard pile purchases and changes unlit candles so that they can be used to steal a candle from another player.

Candle Quest is a re-theme of It's Alive! with a new publisher and artist; while It's Alive! was a re-theme of the original self-published 2005 version of Candle Quest which was called The Menorah Game.

While the theme features a Menorah related to the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah, there is no religious content in the game.

What's In The Box?:

•    One full color 9-page Rules booklet
•    60 Candle cards
•    5 player screens
•    54 Shekel coins
•    One bright red, 9 1/4" x 5 7/8" Standard cardboard VPG game box
•    One beautiful box cover sleeve
•    One "Wipes-A-Lot" napkin
•    One charcoal desiccant packet

Reimplemented by (and reimplements)


    It's Alive!

It's charades with an exciting, fun and frantic twist. To start, players divide into two or three teams. Each team moves to a different corner of the room or even to different rooms if space allows. now, one member from each team goes to the host who opens the first door on the specially-designed game console to reveal the first charade. The players run back to their teams and act out the charade. As soon as a team member guesses the charade correctly, they run to the host to get the second charade as displayed in the game console. The first team to get all 7 charades wins.

Traditional Charades also included in this game. The game also includes all you need to play traditional charades. Teams move along the game board and land on the seven different categories. Take a card, turn the timer over and start acting out the charade.

Contents:

     Charades game console
     Double-sided charade cards with over 2000 charades
     Gameboard
     Sand timer
     Movers
     Team markers
     Game die
     Category Tokens
     Instructions

From box: It couldn't be easier to play. Make an educated guess for questions such as "how many letters has the longest place name in Australia?" or "what is the height of the largest recorded wave?". the player who comes closest to the correct answer after two guesses takes the lead.

How to play
Pick one of the tools either oar tweezer or spoon
Spin the ship's wheel
Steal the treasure shown on the wheel. the treasure must be picked up with the chosen tool. If Octobuzzy eye's light up or the buzzer sounds the treasure must be returned and play passes  to the next player. 
A turn ends when a treasure is stolen without Octobuzzy's eyes lighting up or buzzer sounding.
Spin again if treasure shown has already been stolen by another player.
Lose a turn if treasure shown has already been stolen by yourself.
The winner is the first player to steal 4 different treasures

Same style as Operation

Long Winding Road provides the chance to run a full season's Marathon Championship with the 141 men and 78 women each running 6 races during the year. You can choose from over 40 courses together with their Weather Modifiers. A Championship season of 12 races for men and 10 for women is suggested, so with each race taking about 2 1/2 hours playing time such a season would take around 60 hours to complete - well within the realms of possibility for many replay gamers if feedback from you is anything to go by.

The aim has been to try to recreate the way in which actual Marathon events develop, with small groups of runners breaking away off the front of the main pack, and others losing ground off the back.

We recommend 40 to 70 starters, although the system can cope with larger numbers if necessary, and we deal with the race in 1 kilometer stages, so it would not be sensible or enjoyable to require a dice roll for every competitor each kilometer. With a field of 70 that would entail around 3000 dice rolls!

So we only concern ourselves with identifying those runners within each Group (in game terms a Group consists of any number of runners from one upwards occupying a single 10-second space of our Endless Track) who need their Rating checked for that particular kilometer of the race to see whether they stay with their present Group, or make a forward or backward movement - that is gain or lose around 10 seconds on their Group over this kilometer.

National, European, Commonwealth, and Asian Championships can be run within the context of the main season's Championship, plus a Team Championship on a race-by-race or full season basis.

An abstract strategy game where the object is to reach the other side of the board (or take all your opponents pieces).

The game takes place on a 6x9 grid and each player has 12 pieces.  Each piece is quartered and each quarter numbered from 1 to 4.  This indicates the number of spaces that piece must move in that direction.  Opponents pieces are taken by moving over them (jumping) or by landing on them.
Each player must avoid the other player on a labyrinth. Every time you make your move, you influence the other player decision for the next move. The one that reaches the center first is the winner.

Magikon is a simple Role Playing Game published in Italian + French only by International Team in 1984. 
The guide to encounters includes 22 different kind of people with illustrations made by Mauro Moretti.
The background: Every 1000 years, the shadow master organizes a competition between magician-knights to chose who will succeed to him as governor of the Magikon castle and the surrounding region.
The players will explore the roads around the castle to find monsters, traps and villages. Every player has the same kind of background, so the team working is not necessary and usually, each player explores different areas.

Dicefest is a strategic, abstract board game for two, three or four players who must manipulate their dice and get them to the other side of the board to win. Players will need to think and plan ahead to gain ground. Knowing how to maneuver the dice efficiently while blocking your opponents’ moves are important elements to winning.

Dicefest is available here;
http://www.geocities.com/roujin27/dicefest.html

An entry level tabletop wargame, that in fact has a greater level of detail than most "beginner" rule sets. Taking the approach of low cost gaming, the pictures and diagrams all depict ways to cut costs and begin gaming, and as such tends to relegate this rule set to a "beginner" level. Set as a platoon or company level engagement, the rules have a unique MG grid to infantry fire resolution. A good example of "low detail" for those that are "painting" impaired.

From the Publisher's Instructions Sheet:

Amnesia is a short-term memory game where you can score if you remember ... and score if you forget. To WIN, just start on START and make it around your triangle to the center of the board.

The financial game of Chinese boxes.
The target of the game is to acquire the absolute majority (160)of the shares. You must go around the board collecting shares and creating new societies and holding companies. Four circuits around four countries give different risk features and you have to manage black funds, bankruptcy, transfers of capital, purchase of shares and the majority of companies. The movement on the board is made by dice rolling.

Note: it is  strongly suspected that this game is identical to Capital Power: The Financial Game of Chinese Boxes. But until someone can compare the two boxes and their contents, we should keep two entries in the database.

The REAL NUMBERS game was designed as a prelude to EQUATIONS. It comes in a handy 5-game kit that can be clipped to a pen in your shirt pocket. The REAL NUMBERS Game provides a practical introduction to the process of finding Solutions from randomly generated symbols similar to what occurs in EQUATIONS. The REAL NUMBERS Game deals with real, rational, irrational, integer, and natural numbers.

From Publisher:

THE MEDITATION GAME offers a delightful excursion into the realm of pure strategy. Though simple in design, the game is rich in creative possibilities and subtle surprises. The colorful playing mat and 49 playing rings are used by two players or teams in the pursuit of “Spontaneous Right Action”. Clear, coherent and comprehensive thought is required for success. THE MEDITATION GAME offers people of all ages a refreshing opportunity to experience a gentle, mental massage.

Gazala-Tobruk game system, of medium complexity, puts the emphasis on armored combat, with tank/armor units at battalion level and regiments and brigades for the infantry. Each type of unit exerts a type of ZoC depending of the quantity and/or quality of its anti tank/armor assets, from rigid ZoC to semi rigid or no ZoC at all.

Other outstanding aspects of the rules are the HQ units that give combat support (There are HQ at the Army, Corps, Division levels, and even at Brigade level for independent British Armored brigades); minefields, air support and Allied redoubts or boxes.

Uno for children Ages 3 and up.

Players are dealt 5 cards, the rest forming a draw pile. The first card from the draw pile is turned over and players take turns matching the top card in the discard pile. Cards can match by number, color or animal. A player who can't match a card must draw from the draw pile. A player must call "UNO" once he is down to a single card. A player who fails to do so and is challenged by another player must draw 2 cards.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

Components:
56 cards
Instructions

Instead of numbers (in the classical version) the cards show some animals and some cards are missing.

Alpen Express is a game that uses a system of trains to move your people from the crowded city to the verdant Alps. The players roll a die and can move one train to the matching number.  Each player can must move one pawn off or on the moved train.

The goal is to have all of your people jump from train to train toward the center of the board.  Sometimes you can't help but aid others, but more times than not if you aren't helping yourself you get the opportunity to block out other player's chance for success.

This is billed as a kids game, but it also works as a nice opener/closer for adults. As this is made from solid wood with working wooden trains, it doesn't make for the most portable filler.

A murder has happened on the Orient Express train. There are 12 characters, the suspects. One player moves the characters around a map of Europe, and he is the only one to know the identity of the killer.
Each of the other players leads a team of 3 detectives around Europe, accomplishing missions that give them clues about the killer's identity, while the killer tries to mislead them.
The detective teams must cooperate, but remembering that only one player will be the winner. If the killer has not been discovered after the set time limit (between 1 and 2 hours), he wins.

From the rules:

Once, the small village of Port Dover, situated on the north shore of Lake Erie, harboured the world's largest fresh water fishing fleet.  Now, become one of the local captains deploying fishing tugboats and vying for the precious freshwater fish.

Essentially, a set collecting / stock manipulation game, players collect "fish" or cubes in 5 different colors.  To collect fish, you send out your boats to one of five ponds.  Usually, when you dispatch a boat to a pond, you change a fishes vaule and move a fish to a different pond.  After three rounds, players score for the value of any fish type for which they have the majority.

Very fast playing, published and distributed for free at Great Lakes Games III.

Each player gets a musical bingo card.  The cards consist of a diamond of whole, half, quarter, eighth, and sixteenth notes distributed across the two musical clefs (treble and bass).  Each card either has notes on the lines or notes on the spaces between the lines.  The placement of the high/low notes are staggered and each card has a different placement of the various note lengths.

The caller selects one of the musical note chits, which have a particular pitch and duration.  Players check their boards to see if they can match that pitch and duration.  If they can, they place a marker on the appropriate note.  Play continues until someone can make a run of 5 notes.

In Fury of Dracula, a game of Gothic adventure, one player takes the role of Dracula while up to four others attempt to stop him by controlling Vampire hunters from the famous Bram Stoker novel.

Dracula has returned, and is determined to control all of Europe by creating an undead empire of Vampires. Dracula uses a deck of location cards to secretly travel through Europe, leaving a trail of encounters and events for the hunters that chase him.

Meanwhile, the hunters attempt to track and destroy Dracula using the limited information available to them - a task easier said than done when their prey has the power to change forms into a wolf or bat, and can even melt away into the mist when confronted.

To save Europe and rid the world of Dracula's foul plague, the hunters must destroy Dracula before he earns enough victory points to win the game... will they have enough wit and bravery to defeat the dark count?

Your adventure takes you from the tree house to the dock at the pond. Along the way you try to correctly answer as many questions about the plant and animal worlds as possible. For every correct answer, and for landing on environmentally friendly spaces, you receive point chips. You lose points for landing on environmentally unfriendly spaces. You may also gain points by successfully rolling to acquire all the parts to a five piece butterfly puzzle. Whoever has collected the most points when the first player reaches the dock is the winner.

La sombra del Aguila (Shadow of the Eagle) rules are a consolidation of the game system that appeared in Alea Magazine issue 16. With a basic rules and advanced rules.

It includes three scenarios: 

    Alcañiz 1809, 
    Maria 1809 
    Castalla 1813.

This game comes with a special 44-card deck with pictures of animals.  Players try to avoid taking raccoon cards which are negative points.  Play is faster than Hearts since the deck is smaller.  The scoring and play rules are also simplified for children.

A balancing game of skill based on the popular book by Dr. Seuss.  Based on their spin, players must place Yertles on a balanced plate without causing them to all fall down!

Contents includes: Tumbler, spinner, 21 Yertles.  (Instructions came printed inside the box top.)

From the web-site description:
"It is the year 1940. France has surrendered. The British and the remains of the French Army have retreated across the English Channel. Germany now controls the whole of Western Europe. The United Kingdom stands alone, waiting for the Germans to strike. Hitler approves plans for an upcoming invasion of the United Kingdom. A plan called Operation: SEALION. The invasion of the United Kingdom is about to begin!"

This follows in the same vein as some other 'Battle' GAME based upon the "Axis & Allies" series, while you'll need to procure the necessary 'bits' from one of those to play this. There are entirely NEW components made up for this, with "Order of Battle" charts, the 'Gamemap', and with '3' SETs(or 'kinds') of CARDs for use in it.

Object:  To peg-in as many places beginning with the letter indicated by the alphabet dial as the timer allows.

Components:  Peg map board of the world, sand timer, alphabet dial, pegs, and instructions (printed inside box top).

The absent-minded elephant game.  Based on the Silly Sidney character from the Hector Heathcote Show.  Players travel through the jungle to find their animal friends.

Contents:  14 cards, 4 pawns, game board, spinner, instructions.

Game found in Alea Magazine #25. Uses Thirty Year War Quad rules to simulate the battles of Las Dunas (Spanish Tercios against a Franco-English army).

Expands

    Thirty Years War

The game that rocked Bedrock!  Players search Bedrock and collect sets of cards with characters, locations, or objects (Fred's Car) from the show.

Includes game board, 4 scoring pegs, game cards, and instructions.

Stimulating, entertaining, and educational with 1,000 questions and answers in regular and advanced format.  Players answer questions about the Bible to win squares on the "Tit Tat Toe" board.

Contents:  Tit Tat Toe board, 10 playing squares, 500 question cards, instructions.

Children scaled board game where children stand in as pawns.

Each player takes his place ate the beginning of his path, He must always move forward the number of steps indicated by the spinner, following the Yellow Brick Road. Obey the signs on each brick. If a a player is in another player's way, you cannot pass him. If a player has been instructed, though, to go to a space already occupied, the more than one player can occupy the space together. The first player to land on the Gate to Oz must spin a number one to enter and win.

Everybody plays on every spin!  Spin the spinner, do the stunt, squeak the squeaker, tag out, and win!

Contents:  Game board, spinner, squeaker, scoring pegs, scoreboard.
